original: Björklund, Karin Mathilda, rektor, Linköping, f. 12/3/92 i Enköp. av kyrkv. Per Olof B. o. Mathilda Larsson. — Stud:ex. i Sthlm 12, teol. kand. i Upps. 18. Stud:res. t. univ. i Grenoble 32, res. i Norge, Danm., Tyskl. o. Frankr. Resesekr. f. Sv. kyrkans miss :styr. 18-21, timlär. v. Sthlms h. folksk. 21-23, förest, f. En-köp. elem:sk. f. fl. 23, ord. ämneslär. i kristend :kunsk. o. hist. i Norrtälje 35, rektor v. Linköp. komm. flick-sk. sed. 37. Ordf. i östergötl. 1. stip :-nd av Fredr. Bremer-förb. o. i Sv:es kyrkl. lär :förb. Linköp.-avd., led. av kyrkofullm.
translated: Björklund, Karin Mathilda, principal, Linköping, b. March 12th, 1892 in Enköping. Daughter of Per Olof B. and Mathilda Larsson, who was a church official. She completed secondary school in Stockholm in 1912 and received a degree in theology from Uppsala University in 1918. She went on study trips to Grenoble University (1932), and to Norway, Denmark, Germany, and France. She was a travel secretary for the Swedish Church's mission board from 1918-1921, an hourly teacher at Stockholm High School from 1921-1923, director of elementary school in Enköping from 1923, and an ordained subject teacher in religious knowledge and history in Norrtälje from 1935. She became principal of the Linköping community girls' school in 1937. She was the chair of the Östergötland branch of the Fredrika Bremer Association and of the Linköping branch of the Swedish Church's teacher association, as well as a member of the church council.

jobTitle.roleName: Ordained subject teacher in religious knowledge and history
